intro: Anacampseros pycnantha, commonly known as the rock cress, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, cylindrical leaves that store water, adapted to its arid environment. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a vibrant touch to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
